sealedProducts.name: Team Magma vs Team Aqua Booster Box
Team Magma vs Team Aqua Booster Pack

cards.name: Team Aqua's Cacturne
cards.text: This Pokémon is both Grass Darkness type.

attacks.name: Dark Bind
attacks.text: You may discard a Darkness Energy card attached to Team Aqua's Cacturne. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Barb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Team Aqua's Crawdaunt
cards.text: This Pokémon is both Water Darkness type.

attacks.name: Aqua Reverse
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has Team Magma in its name and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

attacks.name: Deep Impact
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Team Aqua's Kyogre

abilities.name: Power Saver
abilities.text: As long as the number of Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) that has Team Aqua in its name is 3 or less, Team Aqua's Kyogre can't attack.

cards.text: This Pokémon is both Water Darkness type.

attacks.name: Aqua Trip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Aqua Smash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Team Aqua's Manectric

abilities.name: Power Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move any number of basic Energy cards attached to 1 of your Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Team Aqua's Manectric is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: This Pokémon is both Lightning Darkness type.

attacks.name: Thunderspark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) that has Energy cards attached to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Team Aqua's Sharpedo
cards.text: This Pokémon is both Water Darkness type.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Team Aqua's Sharpedo.

attacks.name: Aqua Slash
attacks.text: Team Aqua's Sharpedo can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: Team Aqua's Walrein
cards.text: This Pokémon is both Water Darkness type.

attacks.name: Power Blow
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Team Aqua's Walrein.

attacks.name: Hydro Reverse
attacks.text: You may return any number of basic Water Energy cards attached to all of your Pokémon to your hand. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy you returned.

cards.name: Team Magma's Aggron
cards.text: This Pokémon is both Fighting Darkness type.

attacks.name: Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to Team Magma's Aggron. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Land Stream
attacks.text: You may discard any number of basic Energy cards attached to Team Magma's Aggron. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each basic Energy card you discarded.

cards.name: Team Magma's Claydol

abilities.name: Magma Switch
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move an Energy card attached to your Pokémon with Team Magma in its name to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Team Magma's Claydol is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: This Pokémon is both Psychic Darkness type.

attacks.name: Dark Hand
attacks.text: If you have more cards in your hand than your opponent, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Team Magma's Groudon

abilities.name: Power Saver
abilities.text: As long as the number of Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) that has Team Magma in its name is 3 or less, Team Magma's Groudon can't attack.

cards.text: This Pokémon is both Fighting Darkness type.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Pulverize
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has at least 2 damage counters on it, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Team Magma's Houndoom
cards.text: This Pokémon is both Fire Darkness type.

attacks.name: Roasting Heat
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Burned, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Magma Spurt
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards from your deck. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Fire and Fighting basic Energy cards discarded in this way.

cards.name: Team Magma's Rhydon
cards.text: This Pokémon is both Fighting Darkness type.

attacks.name: Magma Jab
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Shoot Down
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has Team Aqua in its name, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Team Magma's Torkoal
cards.text: This Pokémon is both Fire Darkness type.

attacks.name: Magma Burn
attacks.text: Discard the top card from your opponent's deck, and flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Team Magma's Torkoal.

attacks.name: Hot Air
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Team Magma's Torkoal and your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon (1 if there is only 1). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Kerzap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage to the Defending Pokémon and discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Raichu.

attacks.name: Poison Reaction
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Double Claw
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Mystic Fang
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Aqua Trance
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Super Hypnoblast
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Thick Poison

attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.text: You may move a Fire Energy card attached to Team Magma's Camerupt to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Body Slam

attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy card attached to Team Magma's Rhydon.

attacks.name: Call for Family

cards.name: Team Aqua Schemer
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Discard any 1 Pokémon from your hand. Then draw 3 cards. If you discarded a Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name, draw 4 cards instead.

cards.name: Team Magma Schemer
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Discard any 1 Pokémon from your hand. Then draw 3 cards. If you discarded a Pokémon with Team Magma in its name, draw 4 cards instead.

cards.name: Archie
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Search your deck for a Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as a Basic Pokémon. If it is a Stage 2 Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

cards.name: Dual Ball
cards.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Maxie
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Search your hand or discard pile for a Pokémon with Team Magma in its name and put it onto your Bench. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as a Basic Pokémon. If it is a Stage 2 Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

cards.name: Strength Charm
cards.text: Attach Strength Charm to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.,Whenever an attack from the Pokémon that Strength Charm is attached to does damage to the Active Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage. At the end of the turn in which this happens, discard Strength Charm.

cards.name: Team Aqua Ball
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon that has Team Aqua in its name, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If tails, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon that has Team Aqua in its name, show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Team Aqua Belt
cards.text: Attach Team Aqua Belt to 1 of your Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.,At any time between turns, if the Pokémon Team Aqua Belt is attached to is your Active Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it on that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward, then discard Team Aqua Belt.

cards.name: Team Aqua Conspirator
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Basic Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name and basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Team Aqua Hideout
cards.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.,Each Pokémon that does not have Team Aqua in its name pays Colorless more to retreat.

cards.name: Team Aqua Technical Machine 01
cards.text: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon that has Team Aqua in its name. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Team Aqua Technical Machine 01.

attacks.name: Miracle
attacks.text: Choose 1 Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

cards.name: Team Magma Ball
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon that has Team Magma in its name, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. If tails, search your deck for a Basic Pokémon that has Team Magma in its name, show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Team Magma Belt
cards.text: Attach Team Magma Belt to 1 of your Pokémon with Team Magma in its name that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.,At any time between turns, if the Pokémon Team Magma Belt is attached to is your Active Pokémon, search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and put it on that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward, then discard Team Magma Belt.

cards.name: Team Magma Conspirator
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Search your deck for up to 2 in any combination of Basic Pokémon with Team Magma in its name and basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Team Magma Hideout
cards.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.,Whenever any player plays a Basic Pokémon that doesn't have Team Magma in its name from his or her hand, that player puts 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

cards.name: Team Magma Technical Machine 01
cards.text: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon that has Team Magma in its name. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Team Magma Technical Machine 01.

attacks.name: Crushing Magma
attacks.text: Choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and put that card at the bottom of your opponent's deck.

cards.name: Warp Point
cards.text: Your opponent switches 1 of his or her Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. You switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

cards.name: Aqua Energy
cards.text: Aqua Energy can be attached only to a Pokémon with Team Aqua in its name. Aqua Energy provides Water and Darkness Energy but provides 2 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play and has no other effect than providing Energy.) At the end of your turn, discard Aqua Energy.

cards.name: Magma Energy
cards.text: Magma Energy can be attached only to a Pokémon with Team Magma in its name. Magma Energy provides Fighting and /or Darkness Energy but provides 2 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play and has no other effect than providing Energy.) At the end of your turn, discard Magma Energy.

cards.name: Double Rainbow Energy
cards.text: Double Rainbow Energy can be attached only to an Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex). While in play, Double Rainbow Energy provides every type of Energy but provides 2 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy when not in play and has no effect other than providing Energy.) Damage done to your opponent's Pokémon by the Pokémon Double Rainbow Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). When the Pokémon Double Rainbow Energy is attached to is no longer an Evolved Pokémon, discard Double Rainbow Energy.

attacks.text: You may return all basic Energy cards attached to Suicune ex to your hand. If you do, this attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each basic Energy card you returned.

attacks.name: Hyper Pump
